javanews.events.gui
Class CloseJavaNews

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
      javanews.events.gui.CloseJavaNews
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.util.EventListener
public class CloseJavaNews
extends java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

This class handles any request to close the JavaNews application. It does this by closing all log files gracefully and performs garbage collection prior to the application closing.

This class extends the WindowAdapter class and implements the ActionListener interface in order to handle both types of events generate either by the user closing the window, or requesting the application exit through the file menu.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)

Method Detail

windowClosing

public void windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
This method is called when the application window is requested to shut. The program then closes the logs gracefully and performs garbage collection before ordering the system to exit with a shutdown code of 1 (successful shutdown).

Specified by:
windowClosing in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
Overrides:
windowClosing in class java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
Parameters:
e - The triggered WindowEvent

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
This method is called when the user clicks on File > Exit from the JavaNews menu bar. The program then closes the logs gracefully and performs garbage collection before ordering the system to exit with a shutdown code of 1 (successful shutdown).

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
ae - The generated ActionEvent

closeApp

private void closeApp()
This method is called by both the actionPerformed() and windowClosing() methods. The actual functions are stored in this method to further centralise the code being executed. Any changes to the execution of the program during shutdown should be made here.
